verse:
न जातु कामः कामानामुपभोगेन शाम्यति ।
हविषा कृष्णवर्त्मेव भूय एवाभिवर्धते ॥

terms.kāmānām: of persons who are very lusty

vedabase.translation: As supplying butter to a fire does not diminish the fire but instead increases it more and more, the endeavor to stop lusty desires by continual enjoyment can never be successful. [In fact, one must voluntarily cease from material desires.]
vedabase.purport: One may have enough money and enough resources to satisfy the senses but still not be satisfied, for the endeavor to stop lusty desires by enjoying can never be successful. The example given here is very appropriate. One cannot stop a blazing fire by trying to extinguish it with butter.

terms.कामानामुपभोगेन: By the enjoyment of objects of desire

bard.meaning: Overall meaning:Desire is never satiated by enjoyment of desires, like the black serpent increases in size by consuming offerings.
